1.verse: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, to the church of God being in Corinth, together-with all the saints being in all Achaia:

2.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

3.verse: Blessed Be God For Comforting Us In All Our Sufferings - Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of compassions and God of all comfort,

4.verse: the One comforting us concerning all our affliction so that we might be able to comfort the ones in every affliction with the comfort by which we ourselves are being comforted by God.

5.verse: Because just as the sufferings of Christ are abounding in us, so our comfort also is abounding through Christ.

6.verse: And if we are being afflicted— it is for the sake of your comfort and salvation. If we are being comforted— it is for the sake of your comfort, the comfort being at-work in your endurance of the same sufferings which we also are suffering.

7.verse: And our hope for you is firm, knowing that as you are sharers of the sufferings, so also of the comfort.

8.verse: For We Despaired Even of Living, But God Delivered Us, And Will Deliver Us - For we do not want you to be unaware, brothers, with-reference-to our affliction having taken place in Asia, that we were burdened extremely beyond our power, so that we despaired even of living.

9.verse: But we had the sentence of death in ourselves in order that we should not be trusting in ourselves, but in God, the One raising the dead,

10.verse: Who delivered us from so great a death, and will deliver us; in Whom we have put our hope that He will indeed still deliver us—

11.verse: you also joining-in-helping in your prayer for us— in-order-that thanks might be given on our behalf by many faces as to the gift granted to us through many prayers.

12.verse: Our Boast As We Endure Our Suffering Is Our Blameless And Forthright Behavior Toward You - For our boasting is this: the testimony of  our conscience that we conducted-ourselves in the world, and especially toward you, in simplicity and purity from God; and not in fleshly wisdom, but in the grace of God.

13.verse: For we are writing no other things to you other than the things which you read or indeed understand. And I hope that you will understand until the end—

14.verse: just as you also did understand us in part— that we are your boast, even as you also are ours, on the day of our Lord Jesus.

15.verse: And In This Confidence I Was Intending To Come To You First, Then Go To Macedonia - And in this confidence, I was intending first to come to you in order that you might have a second benefit,

16.verse: and to go through you to Macedonia, and from Macedonia to come again to you, and to be sent-forward by you to Judea.

17.verse: I Do Not Make My Plans Lightly, But I Changed My Plans In Order To Spare You - Therefore, while intending this, I did not then act with lightness, did I ? Or do I plan the things which I plan according-to the flesh— so that there is with me the yes, yes, and the no, no?

18.verse: But as God is faithful, our message to you is not yes and no.

19.verse: For God’s Son Jesus Christ, the One having been proclaimed among you by us— by me and Silvanus and Timothy— did not become yes and no, but has become yes in Him.

20.verse: For as many as there are promises of God, in Him is the yes! Therefore also through Him is [spoken] the amen to God for His glory, through us.

21.verse: And the One establishing us with you for Christ and having anointed us is God—

22.verse: the One also having sealed us and given the pledge of the Spirit in our hearts.

23.verse: And I call-upon God as witness for my soul that sparing you I no longer came to Corinth—

24.verse: not that we are lording-over your faith, but we are fellow-workers of  your joy. For you stand in your faith.

1.verse: For I Did Not Want My Coming To Cause You Grief, So I Wrote To You Instead - For I determined this for myself: not to come to you again in grief.

2.verse: For if I grieve you, who indeed is the one cheering me except the one being grieved by me?

3.verse: And I wrote this very thing in order that having come, I should not have grief from the ones of whom I ought-to-have rejoicing— having confidence in you all that my joy is the joy of you all.

4.verse: I Wrote To You In Anguish Not To Grieve You, But Out of Love For You - For I wrote to you through many tears, out of much affliction and anguish of heart— not that you might be grieved, but that you might know the love which I have especially for you.

5.verse: But if anyone has caused-grief, he has grieved not me, but in part (that I not be a burden), you all.

6.verse: This punishment by the majority is sufficient for such a one,

7.verse: so that on-the-contrary, instead you should forgive and comfort him, that such a one should not somehow be swallowed-up by more grief.

8.verse: Therefore I urge you to confirm your love for him.

9.verse: I Also Wrote To Test Your Obedience To God - For I also wrote for this purpose: that I might know your approvedness, whether you are obedient in all things.

10.verse: And to whom you are forgiving anything, I also. For indeed what I have forgiven, if I have forgiven anything, is for your sakes in the presence of Christ,

11.verse: in order that we may not be exploited by Satan. For we are not unaware as to his schemes.

12.verse: So Instead I Went To Macedonia First To Find Titus - Now having come to Troas for the good-news of Christ, and a door having been opened for me by the Lord,

13.verse: I had no rest in my spirit at my not finding Titus my brother. But having said-goodbye to them, I went forth to Macedonia.

14.verse: I Praise God That He Is Always Spreading The Aroma of Christ Through Us Everywhere - But thanks be to God, the One always leading us in triumph in Christ, and making the aroma of  the knowledge of Him known through us in every place.

15.verse: Because we are the fragrance of Christ for God among the ones being saved, and among the ones perishing—

16.verse: to the ones an aroma from death to death, but to the others an aroma from life to life. And who is sufficient for these things?

17.verse: For we are not like the many peddling the word of God. But as from purity, but as from God, we are speaking in Christ before God.

1.verse: You Yourselves Are Proof To Everyone That God Is Working Through Us - Are we beginning to commend ourselves again? Or we do not have-need of letters of recommendation to you or from you, like some, do we?

2.verse: You are our letter— it having been inscribed in our hearts, it being known and being read by all people,

3.verse: you being made-known that you are a letter from Christ having been served by us, having been inscribed not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God, not in tablets made-of-stone but in tablets which are hearts made-of-flesh.

4.verse: It Is God Who Makes Us Sufficient As Ministers of His New Covenant - And we have such a confidence through Christ toward God—

5.verse: not that we are sufficient from ourselves to count anything as out of ourselves, but our sufficiency is from God,

6.verse: Who indeed made us sufficient as ministers of a new covenant, not of the letter but of the Spirit. For the letter kills, but the Spirit gives-life.

7.verse: And This Ministry Is More Glorious Than That of The Old Covenant - And if the ministry of death having been engraved in letters on stones came in glory (so that the sons of Israel could not look-intently at the face of Moses because of the glory of his face— the glory passing-away),

8.verse: how shall the ministry of the Spirit not be more in glory!

9.verse: For if in the ministry of condemnation there was glory, by much more the ministry of righteousness is abounding in glory.

10.verse: For indeed the [ministry of the letter] having been glorified has not been glorified in this respect— because of the surpassing glory!

11.verse: For if the [ministry of the letter] passing-away was with glory, by much more the [ministry of the Spirit] remaining is in glory.

12.verse: We Don’t Veil The Glory Like Moses. We Reflect It And Are Transformed By It - Therefore, having such a hope, we are using great boldness,

13.verse: and are not like Moses. He was putting a veil on his face so that the sons of Israel might not look-intently at the end of the [face of glory] passing-away.

14.verse: But their minds were hardened, for until this very day the same veil remains on the reading of the old covenant— it not being unveiled because it passes-away in Christ.

15.verse: Indeed, until today whenever Moses is being read, a veil lies on their heart.

16.verse: But whenever it turns to the Lord, the veil is taken-away.

17.verse: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom!

18.verse: But we all with a face having been unveiled, while reflecting the glory of the Lord as a mirror, are being transformed into the same image from glory to glory, just-as from the Lord, the Spirit.

1.verse: So We Don’t Lose Heart In This Ministry Or Its Reception; God Is Shining Through Us - For this reason, having this ministry even-as we received-mercy, we do not lose-heart.

2.verse: But we renounced the hidden things of  shame, not walking in craftiness, nor handling-deceitfully the word of God, but by the open-disclosure of the truth, commending ourselves to every conscience of mankind in the sight of God.

3.verse: And if indeed our good-news is veiled, it is veiled in the ones perishing,

4.verse: in whose case the god of this age blinded the minds of the unbelievers so that they might not see the illumination of the good-news of the glory of Christ— Who is the image of God.

5.verse: For we are not proclaiming ourselves, but Jesus Christ as Lord, and ourselves as your slaves for the sake of Jesus,

6.verse: because God, the One having said “Light will shine out of darkness”, is He Who shined in our hearts for the illumination of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

7.verse: God Is Making Life Known Through Clay Vessels Handed Over To Death - But we have this treasure in vessels made-of-clay, in order that the excess of the power may be God’s and not from us—

8.verse: in every way being afflicted but not restrained, being perplexed but not utterly-perplexed,

9.verse: being persecuted but not forsaken, being struck down but not perishing;

10.verse: at-all-times carrying-around in our body the dying of Jesus in order that the life of Jesus may also be made-evident in our body.

11.verse: For we the ones living are always being handed-over to death for the sake of Jesus, in order that the life of Jesus may also be made-evident in our mortal flesh.

12.verse: So then, death is at-work in us, but life in you.

13.verse: But We Believe And Speak Because We Know God Will Raise Us Up With Jesus - But having the same spirit of faith in accordance with the thing having been written, “I believed, therefore I spoke” [Ps 116:10]— we also believe, therefore we also speak,

14.verse: knowing that the One having raised the Lord Jesus will also raise us with Jesus, and will present us with you.

15.verse: For all things are for your sakes— in order that grace, having increased through the more people, may cause thanksgiving to abound to the glory of God.

16.verse: And Our Affliction Is Producing an Eternal Weight of Glory For Us In Heaven - Therefore we do not lose-heart. But even though our outer person is being destroyed, nevertheless our inner person is being renewed day in and day out.

17.verse: For the momentary lightness of our affliction is producing for us an eternal weight of glory extremely beyond measure,

18.verse: while we are not looking-for the things being seen, but the things not being seen. For the things being seen are temporary, but the things not being seen are eternal.

1.verse: For we know that if our earthly house— our tent— is torn-down, we have a building from God, a house not-made-by-human-hands, eternal, in the heavens.

2.verse: We Do Indeed Groan In This Body And Would Prefer To Get Home To The Lord - For indeed in this tent we are groaning, yearning to put-on-over ourselves our dwelling from heaven—

3.verse: inasmuch as we, having taken-off  this tent, shall not be found naked.

4.verse: For indeed we, the ones being in the tent, are groaning, being burdened, because we do not want to take-off  our earthly tent, but to put on our heavenly dwelling over it, in order that the mortal may be swallowed-up by the life.

5.verse: And the One having made us for this very thing is God, the One having given us His pledge: the Spirit.

6.verse: So while always being confident, and knowing that while being-at-home in the body we are away-from-home, from the Lord

7.verse: (for we walk by faith, not by appearance)—

8.verse: yet we are confident and prefer rather to get-away-from-home, out of the body, and to get-at-home with the Lord.

9.verse: Therefore We Are Ambitious To Please Him By Persuading People - Therefore we indeed are ambitious to be pleasing to Him— whether being at-home or being away-from-home.

10.verse: For we all must appear before the judgment-seat of Christ in order that each one might receive-back the things done in the body, in-accordance-with the things which he practiced, whether good or bad.

11.verse: Therefore knowing the fear of the Lord, we are persuading people. Now Our Heart Has Been Made Known To God, And I Hope To You. Boast In Us -Now we have been made known to God. And I hope that we also have been made known in your consciences.

12.verse: We are not again commending ourselves to you, but are giving you an opportunity for a boast about us, in order that you may have an answer for the ones boasting in appearance and not in heart.

13.verse: For if we lost-our-senses, it is for God! If we are sound-minded, it is for you!

14.verse: For The Love of Christ Controls Us As We Live a New Life For Him - For the love of  Christ controls us, we having determined this— that One died for all, therefore all died.

15.verse: And He died for all so that the ones living might no longer be living for themselves, but for the One having died and been raised for them.

16.verse: So then from now on, we regard no one based-on the flesh. Even though we have known Christ based on the flesh, nevertheless now we no longer are knowing Him thus.

17.verse: So then if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation. The old things passed-away; behold, new things have come-into-being.

18.verse: And God Gave Us This Ministry of Reconciliation As His Ambassadors - And all things are from God, the One having reconciled us to Himself through Christ, and having given us the ministry of reconciliation:

19.verse: how that God was in Christ reconciling the world to Himself— not counting their trespasses against them, and having placed the message of reconciliation in us.

20.verse: Therefore, we are ambassadors on behalf of Christ, since God is appealing through us. We Are Begging People To Be Reconciled To God... -We are begging on behalf of Christ: “Be reconciled to God!

21.verse: He made the One not having known sin to be sin for us, in order that we might become the righteousness of God in Him”...

1.verse: We Are Appealing To You Too! - And working-with Him, we also are appealing that you not receive the grace of God in vain.

2.verse: For He says [in Isa 49:8], “I heard you at the acceptable time. And I helped you on the day of salvation”. Behold, now is the very-acceptable time. Behold, now is the day of salvation.

3.verse: ... In The Process Giving Them No Opportunity For Stumbling... - ... in nothing giving any opportunity-for-stumbling, in order that the ministry may not be faulted,

4.verse: ... But Commending Ourselves While Enduring The Bad And Persevering In The Good - ... but in everything, as God’s servants, commending ourselves in great endurance— in afflictions, in constraints, in distresses,

5.verse: in beatings, in prisons, in disturbances, in labors, in watchings, in fastings;

6.verse: in purity, in knowledge, in patience, in kindness, in a holy spirit, in sincere love,

7.verse: in the word of truth, in the power of God; through the weapons of  righteousness for the right hand and the left;

8.verse: through glory and dishonor, through evil-report and good-report; as deceivers and true ones,

9.verse: as being not-known and being fully-known; as dying and behold we live, as being disciplined and not being put-to-death,

10.verse: as being grieved but always rejoicing; as poor but enriching many, as having nothing and holding-on-to all things.

11.verse: Open Your Hearts To Us, Corinthians - Our mouth has opened to you, Corinthians; our heart has been opened-wide.

12.verse: You are not restrained in us, but you are restrained in your own deep-feelings.

13.verse: Now as the same return— I speak as to my children— you also open-wide.

14.verse: Do Not Be Mis-Yoked To Unbelievers; Be Separated Out To God Your Father - Do not be ones being mis-yoked to unbelievers. For what partnership is there for righteousness and lawlessness? Or what fellowship is there for light with darkness?

15.verse: And what is the harmony of Christ with Beliar? Or what share is there for a believer with an unbeliever?

16.verse: And what agreement is there for the temple of God with idols? For we are the temple of the living God, just as God said [in Lev 26:12], that “I will dwell in them, and I will walk-among them, and I will be their God, and they will be My people”.

17.verse: Therefore, “Come out of their midst and be separated”, says the Lord, “and do not touch an unclean thing. And I will take you in

18.verse: and be a father to you, and you will be sons and daughters to me”, says the Lord Almighty.

1.verse: Therefore, having these promises, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from every stain of flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.

2.verse: Make Room For Us In Your Hearts - Make-room-for us— we wronged no one, we corrupted no one, we exploited no one.

3.verse: I am not speaking for your condemnation. For I have said-before that you are in our hearts so as to die-together and to live-together.

4.verse: There is great confidence in me toward you. There is much boasting by me about you. When I Found Titus In Macedonia, I Was Comforted By His Report About You -I have been filled with comfort. I am super-abounding with joy in all our affliction.

5.verse: For indeed we having come to Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we were being afflicted in every way— battles outside, fears inside.

6.verse: But the One comforting the downcast, God, comforted us by the coming of Titus;

7.verse: and not only by his coming, but also by the comfort with which he was comforted over you while reporting to us your yearning, your mourning, your zeal for me, so that I rejoiced more.

8.verse: I Am Rejoicing At Your Repentance And Actions After You Received My Letter - Because even though I grieved you by the letter, I do not regret it. Even though I was regretting it (for I see that that letter grieved you, even though for an hour),

9.verse: now I am rejoicing— not that you were grieved, but that you were grieved into repentance. For you were grieved in-accordance-with God, in order that you might suffer-loss in nothing by us.

10.verse: For the grief in accordance with God works unregretted repentance leading-to salvation. But the grief of the world produces death.

11.verse: For behold this very thing— the being grieved in accordance with God— how much earnestness it produced in you; even a defense, even indignation, even fear, even yearning, even zeal, even punishment. In everything you demonstrated yourselves to be pure in the matter.

12.verse: So even though I wrote to you [causing grief], it was not for the sake of the one having done wrong, nor for the sake of the one having been wronged, but for the sake of making your earnestness for us evident to you in the sight of God.

13.verse: For this reason, we have been comforted. I Rejoiced Even More At The Joy of Titus Over You -But in addition to our comfort, we rejoiced even more abundantly over the joy of Titus, because his spirit has been refreshed by you all.

14.verse: Because if I have boasted anything to him about you, I was not put-to-shame. But as we spoke all things to you in truth, so also our boasting before Titus proved-to-be the truth.

15.verse: And his deep-feelings are especially for you, while remembering the obedience of you all— how you received him with fear and trembling.

16.verse: I am rejoicing because in everything I am confident in you.

1.verse: Macedonia Gave Sacrificially, So We Urged Titus To Go Complete Your Gracious Gift - Now we make known to you, brothers, the grace of God having been granted in the churches of Macedonia—

2.verse: that in a great test of  affliction their abundance of joy and their down deep poverty abounded into the riches of their generosity.

3.verse: Because I testify that they gave in accordance with their ability and beyond their ability, of-their-own-accord,

4.verse: with a great appeal begging from us the favor and the partnership in this ministry to the saints—

5.verse: and not as we hoped, but they gave themselves first to the Lord and to us by the will of God—

6.verse: so that we urged Titus that just as he previously-began, so also he should complete this grace with reference to you also.

7.verse: I Urge You To Abound In This Grace of Giving Because It Is Beneficial For You! - But just as you are abounding in everything— in faith and speech and knowledge and all earnestness, and in the love from us in you— I urge that you also be abounding in this grace.

8.verse: I am not speaking by way of command, but am proving through the earnestness of others the genuineness of your love also.

9.verse: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ— that for your sakes He became-poor while being rich, in order that you might become-rich by the poverty of that One.

10.verse: And I am giving an opinion in this matter, for this is beneficial for you, who began-beforehand from last year not only the doing, but the wanting to do.

11.verse: But now indeed complete the doing, so that just as was the eagerness of the wanting, so also may be the completing out of what you have.

12.verse: A Gift Proportionate To Your Abundance Is Acceptable For Their Need - For if the eagerness is there, it  is acceptable to whatever degree a person may have, not to-the-degree he does not have.

13.verse: For it is not in order that there may be rest for others, affliction for you, but out of equality—

14.verse: at the present time your abundance being for the need of those ones, in order that the abundance of those ones also may come-to-be for your need, so that there may be equality.

15.verse: Just as it has been written [in Ex 16:18], “The one gathering much did not increase, and the one gathering little did not have-less”.

16.verse: Titus Was Eager To Go To You. So Demonstrate Your Love For All To See - Now thanks be to God, the One having given the same earnestness for you in the heart of Titus.

17.verse: Because he welcomed the urging— but being more earnest, went-out to you of-his-own-accord!

18.verse: And we sent with him the brother whose praise in the good-news is through all the churches,

19.verse: and not only this, but who was also appointed by the churches to be our fellow-traveler with this grace-gift being ministered by us for the glory of the Lord Himself, and to show our eagerness—

20.verse: avoiding this: that anyone should fault us in this abundance being ministered by us.

21.verse: For we are providing-for good things not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of people.

22.verse: And we sent with them our brother whom we often proved in many things as being diligent, but now is much more diligent with great confidence in you.

23.verse: If any ask about Titus— he is my partner and fellow-worker for you; if as to our brothers— they are delegates of the churches, a glory of  Christ.

24.verse: Therefore, be demonstrating to them, to the face of the churches, the demonstration of your love and our boasting about you.

1.verse: For I Have Boasted of Your Eagerness To Others, So I Want You Ready When I Come - For indeed, it is superfluous for me to write to you concerning the ministry to the saints.

2.verse: For I know your eagerness, which I am boasting about you to the Macedonians— that “Achaia has been prepared [to give] since last year”. And your zeal stirred-up the majority.

3.verse: But I sent the brothers in order that our boast about you might not be made-empty in this respect: in order that, just as I was saying, you may be prepared,

4.verse: that we should not somehow be put-to-shame (that I not say you) in this confidence if Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared.

5.verse: Therefore I regarded it necessary to urge the brothers that they go-ahead to you and prepare-beforehand your previously-promised blessing, that this may be ready thus as a blessing and not as greediness.

6.verse: Sow For Blessings, As You Freely Choose In Your Hearts: God Loves a Cheerful Giver - Now this I say: the one sowing sparingly will also reap sparingly. And the one sowing for blessings will also reap for blessings.

7.verse: Each should give just as he has chosen-beforehand in his heart— not out of grief  or out of compulsion. For God loves a cheerful giver.

8.verse: And God is able to cause all grace to abound to you in order that in everything, always having all sufficiency, you may be abounding for every good work.

9.verse: Just as it has been written [in Ps 112:9], “He scattered, he gave to the needy ones, his righteousness remains forever”.

10.verse: God Will Multiply Your Seed And Fruit, And Your Gift Will Abound To His Glory - And the One supplying seed to the one sowing, and bread for eating, will supply and multiply your seed, and will grow the fruits of  your righteousness.

11.verse: In everything you will be enriched for all generosity, which through us is going to produce thanksgiving to God,

12.verse: because the ministry of  this service is not only going to be filling-up the needs of the saints, but also abounding through many thanksgivings to God!

13.verse: Through the approvedness of this ministry, they will be glorifying God for the obedience of  your confession to the good-news of Christ, and the generosity of the contribution for them and for all,

14.verse: while they also are yearning-for you in prayer for you because of the surpassing grace of God upon you.

15.verse: Thanks be to God for His indescribable gift.

1.verse: Now Don’t Make Me Have To Act Boldly Against Some of You, For My Weapons Are Powerful - Now I, Paul, myself, am appealing-to you by the gentleness and kindness of Christ— I who face-to-face am lowly among you, but while absent am-bold toward you!

2.verse: And I am begging that I may not [have to] be bold while present with the confidence with which I am considering to dare [to act] against some considering us as walking in accordance with the flesh.

3.verse: For [though] walking in the flesh, we are not waging-war in accordance with the flesh.

4.verse: For the weapons of our warfare are not fleshly, but powerful in God for the tearing-down of fortresses. We are tearing-down considerations

5.verse: and every height being raised-up against the knowledge of God, and taking-captive every thought to the obedience of Christ,

6.verse: and being ready to punish all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.

7.verse: If I Boast In My Authority In Christ, I Will Not Be Put To Shame - You are looking at things according to appearance. If someone is confident in himself that he is Christ’s, let him consider this again in himself: that just as he is Christ’s, so also are we.

8.verse: For if I should boast anything more about our authority, which the Lord gave for building-up and not for tearing you down, I shall not be put-to-shame—

9.verse: in order that I may not seem as-if I would [merely] frighten you by my letters!

10.verse: Because “The letters”, he says, “are weighty and strong, but the presence of his body is weak, and his speaking is treated-with-contempt”.

11.verse: Let such a one consider this: that such as we are in word by letters while absent, such ones we are also in deed while present!

12.verse: For I Do Not Commend Myself Or Compare Myself To Others - For we do not dare to class or compare ourselves with some of the ones commending themselves. But they— measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves with themselves— do not understand.

13.verse: And I Do Not Boast In Unmeasured Things Or In The Labors of Others - And we will not boast in unmeasured things, but in-relation-to the measure of  the standard which God apportioned to us as a measure: to reach as far as even you.

14.verse: For we are not, as-if not reaching to you, overextending ourselves. For we arrived even as far as you in connection with the good-news of Christ!—

15.verse: not boasting in unmeasured things, in labors belonging-to-others, but having the hope, while your faith is growing, that we might be enlarged in you in relation to our standard of measure, for an abundance;

16.verse: that we might announce-the-good-news in the regions beyond you, not that we might boast in the prepared things in the standard of measure belonging-to-another.

17.verse: The One The Lord Commends Is The Approved One - But “let the one boasting be boasting in the Lord” [Jer 9:24].

18.verse: For not that one commending himself is approved, but the one whom the Lord commends.

1.verse: I Am Jealous For You, For I Fear That You Are Being Corrupted By False Messengers - O-that you would bear-with me as to a little bit of foolishness— but indeed, keep-bearing-with me!

2.verse: For I am jealous-for you with a jealousy of  God. For I betrothed you to one husband, that I might present you as a pure virgin to Christ.

3.verse: But I am fearing that as the serpent deceived Eve by his craftiness, your minds should somehow be corrupted from sincerity and purity for Christ.

4.verse: For indeed if the one coming proclaims another Jesus whom we did not proclaim, or you receive a different spirit which you did not receive, or a different good-news which you did not accept— you bear-with him nicely!

5.verse: For I Come Short of No Other Apostle, Especially In Knowledge - For I think that I have in no way come-short-of  the superlative apostles.

6.verse: But even though I am untrained in speech, nevertheless I am not in knowledge. But in every way we made this evident in all things to you.

7.verse: Or Did I Sin By Not Letting You Pay Me? - Or did I commit a sin [by] humbling myself in order that you might be exalted— because I freely announced-as-good-news to you the good-news of God?

8.verse: I robbed other churches, having taken rations from them for your ministry!

9.verse: And while being present with you and having been in-need, I did not burden anyone— for the brothers having come from Macedonia supplied my need. And in every way I kept and will keep myself unburdensome to you.

10.verse: I Won’t Stop This Boast, For It Cuts Off The Opportunity For False Apostles - As the truth of Christ is in me, this boasting will not be stopped for me in the regions of Achaia!

11.verse: For what reason? Because I do not love you? God knows I do.

12.verse: But what I am doing, I indeed will do in order that I may cut-off the opportunity of the ones wanting an opportunity that they might be found to be just as also we in what they are boasting.

13.verse: For such ones are false-apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into apostles of Christ.

14.verse: And no wonder, for Satan himself transforms himself into an angel of light.

15.verse: Therefore it is no great thing if also his ministers are disguising themselves as ministers of righteousness— whose end shall be according to their works.

16.verse: Don’t Think Me Foolish, But I Too Can Boast - Again I say, let no one think me to be foolish. Otherwise indeed, receive me even if as foolish, in order that I also may boast a little bit!

17.verse: In this confidence of boasting, what I am speaking, I am not speaking according-to the Lord, but as in foolishness.

18.verse: I Also Can Boast In My Heritage And My Service For Christ - Since many are boasting according-to the flesh, I also will boast!

19.verse: For with-pleasure you bear-with the unwise, being wise.

20.verse: For you bear-with it if anyone enslaves you, if anyone devours you, if anyone takes you, if anyone lifts-up himself, if anyone beats you in the face.

21.verse: I speak in-accordance-with my dishonor— how that we have been weak! But in whatever anyone may dare to boast— I am speaking in foolishness— I also dare.

22.verse: Are they Hebrews? I also. Are they Israelites? I also. Are they seed of Abraham? I also.

23.verse: Are they servants of Christ? I speak being distraught, I more— in far-more labors, in far-more prisons, in many-more beatings, in deaths often.

24.verse: But I Will Boast In The Things Pertaining To My Weakness - By Jews five-times I received forty lashes less one.

25.verse: Three-times I was beaten-with-rods. Once I was stoned. Three-times I was shipwrecked. I have done a night-and-day in the deep.

26.verse: On journeys often— in dangers from rivers, in dangers from robbers, in dangers from my nation, in dangers from Gentiles, in dangers in the city, in dangers in the wilderness, in dangers at sea, in dangers among false-brothers.

27.verse: In labor and hardship, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.

28.verse: Apart from the external things, there is the daily pressure on me, the concern for all the churches—

29.verse: who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is caused-to-fall, and I do not burn?

30.verse: If it-is-necessary to boast, I will boast the things of my weakness!

31.verse: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus, the One being blessed forever, knows that I am not lying.

32.verse: In Damascus, the ethnarch of Aretas the king was guarding the city of the Damascenes to seize me.

33.verse: And I was lowered in a basket through a window through the wall and escaped his hands.

1.verse: I Could Boast In My Visions And Revelations From The Lord - It-is-necessary to boast. It is not beneficial, but I will come to visions and revelations from the Lord.

2.verse: I know a man in Christ, fourteen years ago— whether in the body, I do not know, or outside of the body, I do not know. God knows— that such a one was snatched-away to the third heaven.

3.verse: And I know such a man— whether in the body or apart from the body, I do not know. God knows—

4.verse: that he was snatched away into paradise, and heard unspeakable words which are not permitted for a man to speak.

5.verse: I will boast on behalf of such a one. But I will not boast on behalf of myself, except in the weaknesses.

6.verse: For if I should desire to boast, I will not be foolish, for I will be speaking the truth; but I am sparing you, that no one might credit to me beyond what he sees as to me, or hears as to something from me.

7.verse: But God’s Power Is Perfected In Weakness, So I Will Boast In My Weaknesses - And for the excess of the revelations— for-this-reason, in order that I might not be exalted, a thorn in the flesh was given to me; a messenger of Satan to beat me in order that I might not be exalted.

8.verse: I appealed-to the Lord about this three-times, that it might depart from me.

9.verse: And He has said to me: “My grace is sufficient for you. For My power is perfected in weakness”. Therefore most-gladly I will rather boast in my weaknesses in order that the power of Christ may dwell upon me.

10.verse: For this reason I am well-pleased with weaknesses, with insults, with constraints, with persecutions and distresses for the sake of Christ. For whenever I am weak, at that time I am powerful.

11.verse: I Ought To Be Commended By You, For I Did The Signs of The Apostle Among You - I have become foolish— you compelled me! For I ought to be being commended by you! For I in no way came-short-of the superlative apostles, even though I am nothing;

12.verse: the signs of the apostle were produced among you in all endurance in both signs and wonders, and miracles.

13.verse: My Only Shortcoming Is Not Letting You Pay Me! I Will Gladly Spend Myself For You! - For what is it as to which you were worse-off  than the other churches?— except that I myself did not burden you. Forgive me this wrong-doing!

14.verse: Behold— this is the third time I am ready to come to you, and I will not be a burden. For I am not seeking your things, but you. For the children ought not to be storing-up for the parents, but the parents for the children.

15.verse: But I will most gladly spend and be expended for your souls— though while loving you more, I am loved less!

16.verse: And Everyone I Sent You Did The Same As I - But let it be— I did not weigh you down, but being crafty, I took you by deceit!

17.verse: As to anyone of whom I have sent-out to you— I did not exploit you through him, did I ?

18.verse: I urged Titus to go, and I sent the brother with him. Titus did not exploit you, did he? Did we not walk in the same spirit? In the same footsteps?

19.verse: In All This I Am Speaking To Edify You, Lest I Should Have To Come And Mourn Over You - All-this-time are you thinking that we are defending-ourselves to you? We are speaking before God in Christ— and speaking all things, beloved, for the sake of your edification.

20.verse: For I am fearing that having come, I may somehow find you to be not such as I want and I may be found by you to be such as you do not want— that somehow there may be strife, jealousy, rages, selfish-interests, slanders, whisperings, puffings [with pride], disorders;

21.verse: that I having come again, my God should humble me before you, and I should mourn many of the ones having previously-sinned and not having repented over the impurity and sexual-immorality and sensuality which they practiced.

1.verse: When I Come I Will Not Spare Those Seeking Proof of Christ Speaking In Me - This is the third time I am coming to you. Every word shall be established based-on the mouth of two and three witnesses.

2.verse: I have said-before and I am saying-beforehand, as being-present the second time and being-absent now, to the ones having previously-sinned and to all the rest— that if I come again I will not spare you,

3.verse: since you are seeking a proof of Christ speaking in me, Who is not weak toward you, but is strong in you.

4.verse: For indeed He was crucified because-of weakness, but He lives because-of the power of God. For indeed we are weak in Him, but we will live with Him because of the power of God toward you.

5.verse: Prove Yourselves, That Christ Is In You! - Test yourselves to see if you are in the faith! Prove yourselves! Or do you not know yourselves, that Jesus Christ is in you?— unless indeed you are disapproved.

6.verse: But I hope that you will come-to-know that we are not disapproved.

7.verse: We Are Praying For You - And we are praying to God that you may not do anything bad— not in order that we may appear approved, but in order that you may be doing the good, and we may be as disapproved.

8.verse: For we cannot do anything against the truth, but [only] for the truth.

9.verse: For we are rejoicing whenever we are weak but you are strong. This also we are praying— your restoration.

10.verse: I Am Writing So I Don’t Have To Act Severely When I Come - For this reason I am writing these things while absent— in order that while being-present, I may not act severely according-to the authority which the Lord gave me for building-up and not for tearing-down.

11.verse: Finally, brothers, be rejoicing, be restored, be exhorted, be thinking the same thing, be living-in-peace. And the God of love and peace will be with you.

12.verse: Greet one another with a holy kiss.

14.verse: The grace of  the Lord Jesus Christ and the love of  God and the fellowship of  the Holy Spirit be with you all.
